content: my left hand and cc in my right hand because throughout most of this the mc is the accent trying to show through the cc by doing this it creates a better stitch definition to show the design here is a video catching floats as well and holding in both hands interweave also has a tutorial here holding floats with mc i hold my floats every 3-4 sts to make sure the mittens stay nice and tight and i don t get my finger caught in a float while not puckering the fabric andrea mowry has a float tutorial here pattern by virginia cosgriff ravelry virginia718 last updated 5-feb-2026 page 2 of 9 this pattern is for personal use only items made from this pattern may not be sold or produced for commercial purposes mitten construction 0 cast on using us1 in long-tail method co 54 sts with mc 1 cuff  pm and without twisting join the stitches in the round then start k1p1 around for 18 row 54sts  row 1 knit around 1 row while switching to larger needles us 3 while adding 1 stitch around 55sts be sure to pm at 26 sts this marks just before the second side 2 hand & thumb  row 2-47 use the chart 1 for left hand and chart 3 for right hand  use the charts to build the thumb as the pattern progresses increases start on row row 5 of the chart  you will put the thumb stitches on hold at row 21 and use backwards loop cast-on to add the 13 new stitches above the red left or blue right line  continue following chart until decreases 3 decreases  row 48-61 follow the chart for when to decrease keeping in mind that the sides of the mittens are not decrease only the front and back - row 48 k3 following chart ssk knit the chart until 2 before the marker k2tog k3 following chart ssk knit the chart until 2 before the marker k2tog 4 sts decreased 58 sts - row 49-60 same as row 48 4sts decreased every row you will break the cc after row 59 as the chart shows - row 61 k3 sl1 k2tog sl stitch back over 2 sts decreased k3 sl1 k2tog sl stitch back over 2 sts decreased 4 sts decreased total 8sts  when down to 8 sts cut a long tail weave through the loops and secure 4 thumb charts 2 & 4  place 13 sts from hold on one us3 dpn one the second needle pick up 1 sts on one side then pick up 13 sts across that were made with backwards loop and pick up 1 sts on the other side you should have 13 sts on the outside needle and 15 on the inside needle  row 1 knit around with mc  row 2-16 follow the chart  row 17-21 decreases are as follows also seen in the charts
